lines.text: Whenever you want sanctuary, babe, here's where you'll find it.
[tapping thumb to chest]
Right here, in the ol' temple.
Don't tap your heart, you'll break your finger. And if you're sanctuary, I'll take whatever else is lying around.
And as for going around with you, I still pick my own gutters
[first title card]
Deep in the Guianas... a penal colony for men set aside to be forgotten by the world they live in ~~ for men to whom the present, the future and the past are one ~~~~ for men without hope...
You hate hard, baby, so you love hard.
So you outsmarted me, huh?
That's what happens, they tell me, when smart people get together. One of them winds up ahead.

[after the hostile Julie unexpectedly helps him win a fight by throwing a skillet]
Shall I say "thanks," baby, or were you just waving at something?
Don't give me any of that Sister-come-to-Salvation. Look, I'm not buying any. I know the routine. It starts out with a prayer, and ends up with a Bible in one hand and me in the other!
When you've drifted as much as I have then you're glad to drop anchor - even if it is in the mud.
A woman'd be a chump to go on with a guy like me, wouldn't she? What could she win? It's what you call makin' it the hard way. You can't travel that way, can ya baby?
Maybe that's it. But you'd do me a favor and drag me along with you anyway, wouldn't ya? From sewer to sewer.
But on plush cushions!
I said, where you from, baby?
Marseille.
Marseille? Hmm, hot blue nights, the right kind of music, it's a date.
A romantic convict. What are you in for? Stealing doilies?
I'll take all they've got, for a little of this. I don't know what you'll look like tomorrow, but right now, baby, you're the most beautiful dame in the world. Does that mean anything to you?
Not a thing!
No. Supposing I wasn't a convict? Supposing I was sailing through on my yacht or a guy selling brushes?
Yeah, suppose I was Snow White!

It don't make sense, here, this one will start you talking to yourself, listen,"So, God created man in his own image." How do you like that? Now, take a look at me. Do I look like a god to you? This forsaken place is full of gods, I suppose. Only, they're not working at it right now, they're gods' on a holiday! Answer that one.
It sounds simple enough. I think it means that each man has some of the qualities of God inside him, if he wants them and if he looks for them.
Remember this Pig, you're the one man in the world I could never get low enough to touch. Now, get outta here and leave me alone!
Obviously, you know men, how evil they are. Only God is good.
But, the good in man is God, Telez.
Only God is good. Only God can forgive. They stole my crucifix, Cambreau. Without it, I'm lost. I'm afraid.
A crucifix is a piece of wood, Telez. Only a piece of wood. The miracle is not in the wood, but, in the heart.
I see you brought a friend along with you, too. Always room for one more in the boat.
And if there isn't, you can always stay behind.
We'll cut up our rations with you and our water. What do you say?
Big-hearted, ain't you Moll.
Why not. We're all together, aren't we? Everything is share and share alike, with us. With all of us, ain't it! With everything.
Sure it is, with everything that's yours if not mine. Do you get that, Moll? And do you get it, you mugs? Take a good look, because that's all that any of you are going to get.
Hey, baby, stop messing around with the crew and get back here. You belong at the Captain's table, don't ever forget that.
I've got an idea, Grideau. Give me twelve hours to get out and put her
[Julie]
in the dormatory. That way everybody's happy.
